intro: Crusea wrightii var. wrightii, commonly known as Wright's crusea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
